a barrier or gate to block the road
a line of cars waiting to pay the toll
tower: made of stone, metal, or concrete
often has a square or rectangular base
may have windows or other openings
may be topped with a roof or spire
toyshop: a large, rectangular sign with the word "TOYSHOP" in big, colorful letters
a large, glass window with displays of toys
a door with a handle and/or a sign that says "OPEN" or "ENTER"
shelves or racks full of toys
track/outdoor: a track or path for running or walking
a water fountain or other source of water
train_railway: one or more passenger cars or freight cars
a caboose or other type of car at the end of the train
signal lights or crossing gates at intersections
train_station/platform: a raised platform for boarding and disembarking trains
tracks for trains to travel on
signage indicating the name of the station
benches or seats for waiting passengers
tree_farm: a large number of trees in close proximity to each other
trees of the same species planted in rows
tree_house: a support structure made of wood or metal
a ladder or staircase for access
trench: a long, narrow, deep hole in the ground
valley: a large, deep depression in the earth's surface
high, steep walls on either side
a river or stream running through the center
van_interior: a van_interior typically has several seats, a steering wheel, and a dashboard.
there may also be windows, cup holders, and other features.
vegetable_garden: a plot of land with defined boundaries
soil that has been tilled or otherwise prepared for planting
plants growing in rows or other patterns
a water source, such as a hose or sprinkler
gardening tools, such as a spade or rake
veranda: columns or posts supporting the roof
a floor made of wood, concrete, or stone
furniture such as chairs, tables, or couches
veterinarians_office: a waiting room with chairs and/or a couch
a reception area with a desk
viaduct: typically made of concrete or stone
spans a valley or other low-lying area
may have multiple levels or arches
videostore: a large, rectangular sign with the word "VIDEO"
a building with a large glass front
shelves of DVDs and VHS tapes
a counter for renting or returning videos
a door leading to the street
village: a group of small, close-together houses
vineyard: a trellis system to support the grape vines
a vineyard owner or worker walking through the vineyard
barrels or other containers for storing wine
volcano: a crater at the top of the mountain
lava or ash flowing from the crater
smoke or steam rising from the crater
volleyball_court/indoor: a net stretched across the middle of the space
lines marking the boundaries of the court
volleyball_court/outdoor: a net stretched across the middle
lines or markings on the ground to indicate boundaries
waiting_room: a room with chairs for people to sit in
a water cooler or coffee machine
water_tower: a ladder leading to the top of the tank
a platform or catwalk around the top of the tank
a pipe leading from the tank to the ground
waterfall/block: a stand or mount to support the screen
input ports for connecting to other devices
waterfall/fan: a stream of water falling from a height
a fan with blades that rotate to create a breeze
waterfall/plunge: a large body of water falling from a height
a pool of water at the base of the waterfall
rocks or other debris around the waterfall
mist or spray generated by the falling water
watering_hole: a large, open body of water
a source of water, such as a hose or faucet
a drain to remove excess water
a basin or container to hold the water
wave: the wave is usually taller than it is wide
the wave has a crest and a trough
wet_bar: cabinets or shelves for storing glasses, bottles, and other supplies
wheat_field: wheat plants with long, slender leaves
wheat plants with heads of grain
a combine harvester or other farm equipment
wind_farm: power lines running to and from the turbines
windmill: blades or sails attached to the wheel
a windmill is often used to generate electricity
wine_cellar/barrel_storage: racks or shelves for storing wine bottles
wine_cellar/bottle_storage: racks or shelves to store wine bottles
a wine fridge or wine cooler
a wine cellar door or gate
wrestling_ring/indoor: a large, open, square or rectangular area
a raised platform or ring in the center
ropes or other barriers around the perimeter
mats or other padding on the floor
youth_hostel: a sign with the word "youth hostel" or "hostel"
common areas for socializing and relaxing
